channel.title: One thing to take note of
channel.description:
3d art is not 2d art, you cannot finish it with a dirty method (since in 2d the end image is all that matters), you're going to need clean topology and excellent management of polygons and primitives in order to do this efficiently.
What I mean by clean topology (face structure) http://th08.deviantart.net/fs70/PRE/f/2011/138/6/3/templar_knight_by_frell262-d3gnzcd.png
And thats only half of it, you cannot slack off in your textures.
Just a heads up. Just because it [i]looks[/i] like something doesn't mean it accurately represents it.

item.title: One thing to take note of
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Triton, post:14, topic:411816”][quote author=Frell link=topic=513072.msg3727852#msg3727852 date=1314409798]
uhm errwhere. Ive been modeling for 4-5 years now.
[/quote]

How long do you take to make a model like that?

Also do you know how to animate?[/quote]

I plan on learning to animate sometime later this year, but no currently I cannot.

That model took a day.

This I’ve been working on for weeks:
http://th07.deviantart.net/fs71/PRE/f/2011/229/8/3/yuri_character_sculpt_by_frell262-d46vx32.png

More: http://frell262.deviantart.com/gallery/

Read full topic

and Frell where did you learn to model, seriously.

item.source: One thing to take note of

item.title: One thing to take note of
item.dc:creator: @ripzone Triton
item.description:
@ripzone wrote:

I would also add that in modern game development you also need to be able to bake different kinds of maps (occlusion, normal, specular) and also know how to properly generate LOD (level-of-detail) variations of your models, though most 3D authoring packages should help with that.

Nice model, by the way.

Read full topic
item.source: One thing to take note of

item.title: One thing to take note of
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

This is very useful. The low quality slop that most moparscape models are won’t work efficiently in games.

Read full topic
